etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in John Saltmarsh (d. 1647), preacher and religious controversialist. From redemption + -ist

definitions: A person who believes in or advocates redemption or salvation.
A person who redeems another from slavery or captivity; specifically a Trinitarian or Mercedarian. Chiefly historical.
That believes in or advocates redemption or salvation.

notes.text: In early use especially in the names of religious orders.
